channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CoreWeave’s earnings report highlights $56 billion in contracted revenue, but its guidance and share price tick down amid AI infrastructure bubble fears
item.description: All eyes were on the datacenter operator’s RPO figure, which matched Wall Street’s $50 billion-$60 billion expectations.

item.title: Alex Karp Went From Biden Donor to Trump Enabler. Why?
item.description: A tech billionaire professes to hate identity politics, but they seem in some ways to consume him.

item.title: Congress Moves Closer to Ending the Shutdown
item.description: Also, the Supreme Court declined to hear a challenge to same-sex marriage. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

item.title: For Trump, Nothing Was Off-Limits During the Shutdown
item.description: President Trump pressured Democrats by taking punishing actions no previous administration ever took during a shutdown.

item.title: Shutdown Deal Revives Democratic Infighting
item.description: The agreement prompted a backlash within the party, not only against the Democratic defectors who supported it, but against Senator Chuck Schumer, the...

item.title: Trump Pardons the Husband of a Republican Congressional Ally
item.description: Robert Harshbarger Jr. pleaded guilty in 2013 to health care fraud and distributing a misbranded drug. His wife, Diana Harshbarger, is a member of Con...

item.title: Rescuers Search for Missing Migrants Off Malaysia’s Coast
item.description: Rescuers recovered several bodies near the site of a capsized boat carrying members of the Rohingya ethnic minority, which faces persecution in Myanma...

item.title: Syria’s President Meets Trump at White House for First Time
item.description: The visit by President Ahmed al-Shara is another step in the transformation of the former rebel leader once wanted by the United States as a terrorist...

item.title: Medical Marijuana Grower in New Zealand Faces Criminal Charges
item.description: A police raid and criminal case against a longtime cultivator of cannabis in New Zealand’s Northland region has stirred up debates about medicinal mar...

item.title: Thailand Suspends Trump-Backed Peace Talks With Cambodia
item.description: The move, which came after two Thai soldiers were injured by a land mine, imperiled a pledge by the two countries to resolve their longstanding differ...

item.title: Trump Threatens to Sue the BBC for $1 Billion After Jan. 6 Documentary
item.description: A lawyer for President Trump said the BBC’s editing of a speech he gave was “defamatory.” The broadcaster apologized on Monday for an “error in judgme...

item.title: Airport lounges are about to get even more exclusive as some credit card companies jack up annual fees by more than 40%
item.description: One of the most popular travel perk cards, the Chase Sapphire Reserve, just ratcheted up its annual fee from $550 to $795.

item.title: You don’t hate AI because of genuine dislike. No, there’s a $1 billion plot by the ‘Doomer Industrial Complex’ to brainwash you, Trump’s AI czar says
item.description: Remember “Effective Altruism?” The movement led by disgraced crypto kingpin Sam Bankman-Fried is back, lobbying against AI.

item.title: Trump demands $10,000 bonuses for air traffic controllers who worked during shutdown and pay cuts for those who didn’t amid flight chaos
item.description: Air travelers should expect worsening cancellations and delays this week even if the government shutdown ends.

item.title: Trump’s $2,000 tariff ‘dividends’ would cost twice as much as the revenue coming in, budget watchdog warns
item.description: “If tariff dividends are paid annually, deficits would increase by $6 trillion over ten years,” per the Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget.
